english_sentence: You'll need a good oilskin to go out in weather like this.

maori_sentence: He āhua nui tonu nga poka hinu kai Taranaki ināianei.
english_sentence: There are several oil wells in Taranaki now.

maori_sentence: Ko te tikanga kia kore tātau e kaha rawa ki te kai i te kai hinuhinu.
english_sentence: We should not eat too much oily food.

maori_sentence: He rongoā pani tāku kai konei hai whakamauru i to waewae mamae.
english_sentence: I have an ointment here to soothe your sore leg.

maori_sentence: onamata, tērā koe e kite i nga waka e tere ana i te takutai.
english_sentence: In olden times, you would have seen many canoes sailing around the coast.
